title: What are the best apps to find free wifi? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is no app that will give you “free Wi-Fi” Wi-Fi is just wireless LAN connectivity (like using an Ethernet cable, but wirelessly), in order to get Wi-Fi (that is connected to the Internet) you need an ISP (service), a Modem to connect to that ISP, a router and a WAP (Wireless Access Point, the Wi-Fi) In order to get “free Wi-Fi”, you need to be in range of an open (unprotected) Access Point You can usually get free Wi-Fi at a Starbucks or at fast food places like McDonald’s, the idea is that they aren’t exactly free, but you pay by being a paying customer, like when you use Starbuck’s free Wi-Fi, chances are you are going to get a coffee anyway (though there is nothing preventing you from using the Wi-Fi without the purchase of a coffee) In that case, Starbucks (or whatever business providing Wi-Fi) pays the ISP for Internet service and provides Wi-Fi with an on-site router and WAP You can download an app that uses your GPS location to show you places near you where you can get free Wi-Fi, but these apps require an Internet connection to work, which kind of defeats the purpose

The Internet has become very important part of our life.
